params.dkimPublicKeyHash: The hash of the DKIM public key of `emailDomain`
params.emailDomain: The domain of the user's email address
params.emailNullifier: The nullifier computed for the email
params.proof: Proof of email with above constraints
params.psiPoint: PSI point of the user for the relayer
params.walletSalt: Wallet used to create the account (hash of emailAddr and accountSalt)

params.emailAddrCommit: The commitment to the recipient email address
params.rand: Randomness used to create the email address commitment

params.recipientEmailAddrCommit: The hash(emailAddress, randomness) where randomness was set by sender and passed to recipient relayer

verifyEmailOpProof(string,bytes32,uint25.details: `emailAddrPointer`, `dkimPublicKeyHash` should be the values previously stored in the contract

params.dkimPublicKeyHash: The hash of the DKIM public key of `emailDomain`
params.emailDomain: The domain of the user's email address
params.emailNullifier: The nullifier computed for the email
params.hasEmailRecipient: Whether the email subject has a recipient (email address)
params.maskedSubject: The subject of the email with (any) email address masked
params.recipientEmailAddrCommit: The hash of recipeint's email address (from subject) and a randomness
params.walletSalt: The walletSalt used to derive user's account address - hash(emailAddress, accountSalt)

verifyAccountCreationProof(string,bytes3.notice: Verify the proof to create an accountVerifies email from a user that contains `accountSalt` in the email header         where `walletSalt = `hash(fromAddress, accountSalt)`

verifyAnnouncementProof(string,bytes32,b.notice: Verify the proof to announce the email address during Unclaim registration

verifyClaimFundProof(bytes32,bytes32,byt.notice: Verify the proof to claim and unclaimed to a recipient accountThis verify that same email address is used in `recipientEmailAddrPointer` and `recipientEmailAddrCommit`

verifyEmailOpProof(string,bytes32,uint25.notice: Verify the proof of email from user - used to verify EmailOpVerify that relayer received an email where:         sender's email address domain is `emailDomain`,         sender's email address and relayer randmness derives `emailAddrPointer`,         is DKIM signed by public key whose hash is `dkimPublicKeyHash`,         the subject is same as `maskedSubject` with email address masked (if any),         and email address in subject is used to derive `recipientEmailAddrCommit`
